macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Decline on Bank Earnings Disappointment and Iran Tensions
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.5% to 6,926, Dow dropped 0.09% to 49,149, and Nasdaq slumped 1% to 23,471 amid weak investment banking results from major lenders like Citigroup and Wells Fargo, plus rising oil prices over 2% to $62 due to Iran geopolitical risks.

items.title: S&P 500 Inches Up to 6934 Points Amid Mixed Economic Data
items.summary: The US500 rose 0.11% to 6934 points, with Nasdaq up 0.16% driven by Alphabet's 2.5% gain, while JOLTS data showed cooling labor demand, ADP reported modest hiring rebound, and ISM Services PMI beat expectations.

items.title: Markets Cautious on Fed Independence Concerns and Upcoming Bank Earnings
items.summary: US stock futures traded flat to lower ahead of inflation data and bank earnings, pressured by political threats to Federal Reserve independence from Trump and softer core CPI, with energy stocks rising on oil surge from Iran tensions.

items.title: Tech Stocks Sink on China Chip Ban Reports Targeting Nvidia
items.summary: Tech sector weakened with Nasdaq leading losses, as reports emerged of China banning Nvidia's H200 AI chips, contributing to broader market pullback from recent highs.

items.title: Oil Prices Rally Over 2.5% on Escalating Iran Geopolitical Risks
items.summary: Crude oil jumped more than 2.5% to around $62 per barrel after Trump halted engagement with Iran and supported protests, raising supply disruption fears amid broader market unease.

items.title: US Indexes Show Pullback Signals with Nasdaq Breaking Trendline
items.summary: Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq exhibited bearish technical breaks including channel violations and MA crosses, with Nasdaq down 1.50% intraday amid Mag 7 sell-off and Iran-driven risk aversion.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Crosses $97,000 for First Time Since November
items.summary: Bitcoin has surged past the $97,000 level, marking its highest price point since November 2025, as the cryptocurrency market continues its upward momentum.

items.title: Crypto Scams and Fraud Hit Record $17 Billion in Losses for 2025
items.summary: New Chainalysis data reveals that cryptocurrency scams and fraud resulted in at least $17 billion in losses during 2025, the highest level ever recorded.

items.title: Senate Banking Committee Advances Crypto Market Structure Bill
items.summary: The Senate Banking Committee is moving forward with markup on a crypto market structure bill, with provisions addressing stablecoins and regulatory oversight of digital asset exchanges and brokers.

items.title: Pakistan Enters Agreement with Trump Family Crypto Company
items.summary: Pakistan has signed an agreement with a subsidiary of World Liberty Financial, the Trump family's cryptocurrency venture, signaling growing institutional adoption in emerging markets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cognizant Releases 'New Work, New World 2026' Report: AI Could Unlock $4.5 Trillion in U.S. Labor Productivity
items.summary: Cognizant's latest study reveals AI is accelerating faster than projected, potentially impacting 93% of U.S. jobs today and handling $4.5 trillion in tasks, with average job exposure scores at 39%—30% higher than prior 2032 forecasts.

items.title: Alibaba Cloud Unveils Intelligent Chess Player and AI Tennis Coach Robot ACEMATE S10
items.summary: Alibaba Cloud showcased an intelligent chess player and the ACEMATE S10 tennis robot powered by Tongyi Qianwen VL model, which judges ball trajectories and develops real-time strategies using advanced sensors.

items.title: Google Invites Gemini Users to Share Gmail, Photos, Search, and YouTube Data for Personalized Responses
items.summary: Google began allowing Gemini chatbot users to grant access to personal data from Gmail, Photos, Search history, and YouTube in exchange for potentially smarter, more relevant answers.

items.title: CPP Investments: AI Agents Outperform Traditional Processes in Portfolio Reconciliation and Analysis
items.summary: CPP Investments' trials showed AI agents accurately reconciled a $522 million portfolio, conducted performance attribution, and analyzed tariff scenarios, suggesting AI could redefine investing roles with proper governance.

items.title: University of Pennsylvania: Foams Behave Like Learning AI Systems, Revealing New Physics Insights
items.summary: Researchers found everyday foams reorganize like modern AI during training, moving in flat energy landscapes rather than settling into fixed states, with implications for materials and living systems.

items.title: Johns Hopkins Develops AI Decoder for Cancer Patterns Using Machine Learning
items.summary: Alexis Battle's team at Johns Hopkins is using AI and machine learning on genetic data to uncover hidden cancer patterns, predict outcomes, and tailor treatments in collaboration with the cancer center.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Arc Raiders Hits 12.4 Million Units Sold Milestone
items.summary: Nexxon reports Arc Raiders has surpassed 12.4 million units sold since its October launch, with concurrent players peaking at 960,000 in January, highlighting its rapid success in the gaming market.

items.title: Ryan Hurst Cast as Kratos in God of War TV Series
items.summary: MGM Studios announces Ryan Hurst, known from Sons of Anarchy and The Walking Dead, will portray Kratos in the upcoming God of War adaptation, focusing on his journey with son Atreus; pre-production is underway in Vancouver.

items.title: Multiple New Ecco the Dolphin Games Announced
items.summary: The Ecco the Dolphin franchise is returning with multiple new games officially in development, marking a revival of the classic series.

items.title: Kejora and DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT DLC Release Today
items.summary: Adventure game Kejora, featuring puzzle-solving in a hand-drawn world, and DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT - DAIMA: Adventure Through The Demon Realm Pack launch on January 15, 2026.

items.title: Nintendo Faces Investor Pressure Amid Industry Layoffs
items.summary: Nintendo is under investor scrutiny due to recent events, while the broader games industry sees continued studio shutdowns and struggles.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
